message.content:
cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.CYBER, cs.GT 

This paper discusses the use of affect control theory and BayesACT in creating agents that replicate human behavior in the Iterated Networked Prisoner's Dilemma. This involves combining affective reasoning with cognitive reasoning, which is a common theme in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the emergent properties of the networked BayesACT agents, which is related to social networks (cs.SOC) and game theory (cs.GT). Additionally, the paper discusses decision hysteresis, which is related to cybernetics (cs.CYBER) and social influence (cs.SI).
